q: Will a DMP affect my credit file?
a: A DMP itself isn’t recorded as a product, but paying reduced amounts can lead to markers, which affect your credit file while active. We’ll discuss pros and cons before you proceed.
We don’t provide loans. Our focus is on reducing pressure by working with your creditors and prioritising essentials.

Rules vary by debt type. For most consumer credit debts, enforcement agents can’t enter without permission. Priority debts like council tax have different rules. We’ll help you understand your rights.
